topics.body:
Wow; I read something legitimately interesting.  Apparently Hugh Hefner has had more successful marriages than most americans and has been with less women than most americans.


This is purely guessing and probably going to shock a couple people that I'm actually saying something positive about the past, but if I had to take a guess as to why:
He was born in 1926 and the marriage culture of back then was "till death do you part".
Nowadays the average marriage is less than a year long; hell some marriages only last 26 minutes.

What the early half of the 20th century upheld as the "ideal man":
!http://filmmakeriq.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/Casablanca-Two-Shot.jpg!
What the 21th century in the usa *mainstream culture* upholds as the "ideal man":
!http://i.imgur.com/unTOQ.jpg!


Obviously I'm not shit talking people that get divorced, but rather the people that treat marriage like a fad rather than a commitment.
